H0.text: Geothermal heating is the primary energy source driving circulation of ocean currents on Earth.

H1.text: Planetary rotation is the primary energy source driving circulation of ocean currents on Earth.

H2.text: Solar heating is the primary energy source driving the circulation of ocean currents on Earth.

H3.text: Lunar tidal forces are the primary energy source driving circulation of ocean currents on Earth.

A4.text: The thermohaline circulation is driven by global density gradients created by surface heat and freshwater fluxes.

A5.text: Ocean currents are driven by wind, by the gravitational pull of the Moon in the form of tides, and by the effects of variations in water density.

A6.text: Surface oceanic currents are driven by wind currents, the large scale prevailing winds drive major persistent ocean currents, and seasonal or occasional winds drive currents of similar persistence to the winds that drive them

A7.text: The Antarctic Circumpolar Current (ACC), a wind-driven current which flows clockwise uninterrupted around Antarctica
